content.body: that date isnâ€™t known until after the committed build is generated tho
if you commit changes to the spec and then CI generates a separate commit with the build for that spec, CI can use the date of the "changes to the spec" commit to generate the date for the build
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: if you commit changes to the spec and then CI generates a separate commit with the build for that spec, CI can use the date of the "changes to the spec" commit to generate the date for the build

content.body: that would help with the "CI rebuilds spec and causes merge conflicts" issue
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: that would help with the "CI rebuilds spec and causes merge conflicts" issue

content.body: because the default template has this really irritating issue
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: because the default template has this really irritating issue

content.body: GH actions tries to rebuild the spec everytime, even if the commit already updates the built spec and adds fixup commits that need to be addressed but at the very least would cause merge conflicts
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: GH actions tries to rebuild the spec everytime, even if the commit already updates the built spec and adds fixup commits that need to be addressed but at the very least would cause merge conflicts

content.body: so it's pretty much impossible to merge multiple PRs in a row. You have to always rebase all PRs on top of the main branch once you merge anything, it's quite irritating at times.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so it's pretty much impossible to merge multiple PRs in a row. You have to always rebase all PRs on top of the main branch once you merge anything, it's quite irritating at times.
